name: Agricultural Inputs
description: Companies that make products for use in organic farming. These include feedstuffs, fertilizers, and permitted plant protection products. They also make cleaning agents and additives used in food production. These stocks often go up when the need for fertilizer is increased due to conflicts and the lack of food supplies.

name: AI and Machine Learning
description: The artificial intelligence and machine learning bucket is assigned to the companies that move the overall revolution of AI and ML. These companies are moving the industry and creating semiconductors needed for it.

name: Airlines
description: Large airlines listed on US stock exchanges. These stocks tend to react well on increasing passenger flow and declining fuel costs and can be harmed by restrictions on travel and growing oil prices.

name: CRISPR / Gene Editing
description: Gene therapy and gene editing are on the cutting edge of modern biotechnology. Gene therapies are used to correct genetic abnormalities by introducing genetic material at a cellular level. Gene editing takes the science to the next level, seeking to directly alter the genome itself as a therapeutic approach.

name: Automotive Manufacturing
description: Global automotive manufacturing companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: IT Cloud Infrastructure
description: Cloud computing is a highly scalable style of computing that is an essential part of internet technologies. These include managed applications, databases, and function-as-a-service offerings. The industry is rapidly growing due to the high demand for scalable IT infrastructure.

name: Construction Materials
description: Makers of construction (building) materials predominantly used in residential construction. These companies are often positively affected by a growing market and when construction costs increase due to inflation.

name: Cruise Line
description: Global cruise line companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Cloud Database Management
description: Providers of public or private cloud software systems that manage data in cloud storage. These companies profit from increased use of cloud computing and storage.

name: Gold Mining
description: Companies that acquire, develop, and operate precious metal fields, primarily mining for gold. The steady periods of growing gold prices benefit gold companies. Historically, gold mining stocks have outperformed gold prices during bull markets. However, during spikes in inflation, gold mining companies offer less inflationary protection than gold if the operating costs grow faster than the gold prices.

name: Apparel Manufacturing and Retail
description: Apparel manufacturing & retail companies traded on the US stock market. Apparel and retail companies may profit from increasing disposable income of households.

name: EdTech
description: EdTech companies are transforming education using software and a modern approach to the speed learning process. These companies often host multiple video courses and education programs and/or provide the functionality for educators and organizations to create their own learning experiences.

name: Power & Gas Utilities
description: Energy companies produce and distribute electric power and natural gas. Many US electric companies are regulated: the rates are set by the state. Therefore, the revenues may be slow to adjust for growing costs or inflation. On the other hand, electric utilities provide essential services and as other utility companies tend to weather economic turmoils well.

name: Movies, Music and Entertainment
description: Movie and entertainment companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Big Tech
description: The largest companies operating in the tech sector. These companies are the drivers of technological advances. Big tech stocks offer high returns when the market favors growth stocks and tech. On the other hand, they tend to be crowded and prone to high volatility.

name: Restaurants and Fast Food
description: Global restaurants and fast food companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Investment Banking and Brokerage
description: Investment banking and brokerage services providers function as an agent that specializes in selling securities products, such as stocks, mutual funds, and bonds.

name: FinTech
description: Financial technology (Fintech) is used to describe new tech that seeks to improve and automate the delivery and use of financial services.

name: Food Producers
description: Largest food producers listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Oil and Gas Production
description: Companies that explore, produce, refine, and distribute oil, petroleum products, and natural gas. These stocks tend to do better during growing oil prices and economic expansion. However, the revenues of oil & gas companies tend to lag spot prices as most of the production is sold under longer contracts.

name: Furniture and Decor
description: Global furniture and decor companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Green Energy
description: Green or renewable energy companies produce electric power using solar, wind, and hydro power assets. This group also includes companies manufacturing equipment for green energy generation.

name: Hotels and Resorts
description: Global hotel companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Cybersecurity
description: Global information security companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Non-health Insurance
description: These companies create and distribute insurance products except health insurance. They offer Life Insurance, Casualty Insurance, Auto and Property insurance products. Like other Financial Services companies, Insurance companies usually benefit from higher interest rates.

name: Lithium mining
description: Companies that mine lithium and produce lithium compounds. Lithium is key in the production of rechargeable batteries, including those used in electric vehicles.

name: Natural Gas
description: Natural gas companies explore and develop natural gas fields, and produce and distribute natural gas. In most cases, these companies produce not only natural gas but also oil. Oil and gas prices are usually highly correlated.

name: Vaccine Companies
description: Top vaccine and drug manufacturers, including COVID-19 vaccines.

name: REIT Diversified
description: Real estate investment trusts are companies that own and operate real estate. REITs tend to pay meaningful dividends from the rental income they generate. REITs may provide some inflation protection as the value of real estate and rental rates increase with inflation. Diversified REITs often hold real estate across various segments: office, industrial, and residential.

name: Semiconductors
description: Global chip manufacturing companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Logistics and Delivery
description: Сompanies that provide integrated logistics solutions for ground, air, and sea transportation of goods. These companies are likely to benefit from the growing e-commerce market, and increased disposable income. However, they can be harmed by growing petroleum prices as well as higher lease expenses caused by increased interest rates.

name: Steel Manufacturing
description: Producers of steel, steel alloys, and steel products. American steel producers may benefit from the drop of market share of Russian and Ukrainian producers as a result of the conflict in Ukraine

name: Telecom and Internet
description: Global telecom and internet companies that provide services for retail and corporate clients.

name: Trucking and Transportation
description: Trucking companies offer ground logistics solutions for commerce and retail. They own and operate fleets of specialty trucks. The companies are likely to benefit from growing trade and production but can be harmed by growing petroleum prices and increasing interest rates.

name: Travel Technology
description: Travel technology companies that help to book and manage your trip, including apartments, hotels, flights, cars etc.

name: Waste Management
description: These companies collect, recycle, and dispose of solid waste and recyclable materials. As most utilities, they tend to provide lower volatility and can be viewed as defensive assets. Also, the trend on recycling further benefits waste management companies.

name: Banking
description: Large global banks and financial institutions traded on the US stock market. Banks tend to be positively impacted by higher interest rates.

name: E-Commerce Platforms
description: Digital commerce platforms provide the technology that enables customers to purchase goods and services through an interactive online experience. These products help support customers, manage website content, order functionality and data via APIs.

name: Residential Construction
description: Companies that develop, build, and sell residential properties. Their stock prices may be positively affected by the growing demand for residential real estate and can provide some hedge against inflation.

name: Internet Infrastructure
description: Сompanies that provide the technology for faster and more reliable internet services. These companies include hardware and software leaders in each space but do not include IT cloud infrastructure as there is a separate TTF for this.

name: Advanced Materials
description: Companies that produce materials with enhanced properties that improve on traditionally used ones. These include things like plastics, biomaterials, smart materials, and nano-engineered materials.

name: Heavy Equipment and Machinery
description: Global heavy equipment and machinery companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Electric Vehicles: Charging
description: Global electric vehicle charging companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Top-20 for you
description: Stocks that best fit your profile.

name: 3D printing
description: Global companies that manufacture and sell 3D printers and 3D printing materials.

name: Aerospace
description: Global space exploration, travel, cargo, and tourism companies. The majority of these companies are involved in building actual planes and spaceships.

name: Electric Vehicles: Battery Tech
description: Global electric vehicle battery tech companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Cannabis
description: Global cannabis companies listed on US stock exchanges. These companies may profit from the federal legalization of the recreational use of marijuana.

name: Government and Commercial Construction
description: Companies that are engaged in large scale construction projects: from large production facilities to roads, bridges, and electric power systems. These companies do well during economic expansion and higher spending on infrastructure.

name: Analytics and BI Platforms
description: Analytics and business intelligence (ABI) companies provide platforms that enable users, including businesspeople, to model, analyze, and manage data. ABI platforms enjoy higher revenues with growing business activity and an active VC market.

name: Autoparts
description: Companies that manufacure and distribute autoparts. These companies may be positively affected by growing car sales.

name: Car Sales
description: Automobile dealers and online marketplaces. These stocks are often affected by the car sales and prices, as well as the disposable income of US households.

name: Coal Mining
description: These companies produce and distribute thermal and coking coal. Thermal coal is primarily used in electricity & heat generation, while coking coal is a key material for steel production.

name: Consumer Staples
description: Companies that produce and distribute everyday household goods, e.g., food, beverages, cleaning supplies, clothing. This sector tends to do better than the market in times of uncertainty.

name: Copper Mining
description: Companies that produce and distribute copper. Key uses of copper are electrical wiring, roofing and plumbing, as well as industrial machinery.

name: Crypto Exchanges
description: Cryptocurrency exchanges and investing or trading platforms.

name: Crypto Mining
description: Cryptocurrency mining is performed using sophisticated hardware that solves complex math problems for verifying and processing blockchain transactions. Includes companies directly involved with the mining process.

name: Electric Vehicles (EV)
description: Global electric vehicle companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Farming Companies
description: Farming companies producing poultry, fish, milk, meat etc.

name: Firearms
description: Companies that manufacture and distribute firearms and ammunition for military and civil use. Firearm stocks positively react on increased demand for firearms caused by social unrest and expected tightening of firearm regulations.

name: Food Retail Chains
description: The largest food retail chains traded on the US stock market.

name: Gambling and Betting
description: Global gambling companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Health Insurance
description: Companies engaged with health insurance products and benefits for B2B and B2C markets. Health expenses tend to grow with or faster than inflation. The countercyclical nature of the business may deliver better than the market returns in times of economic meltdowns. On the other hand, government regulations may negatively impact health insurance companies if the premiums are heavily regulated.

name: Healthcare
description: The healthcare sector includes companies that produce drugs, medical devices, and provide medical services like health insurance and hospital administration. Health expenses tend to grow with or faster than inflation. Also, the countercyclical nature of the business may deliver better than the market returns in times of economic meltdowns. On the other hand, government regulations may negatively impact health insurance companies.

name: IT Infrastructure Monitoring Tools
description: ITIM tools capture the health and resource utilization of IT infrastructure components, including servers, containers, network devices, storage, and others.

name: Internet of Things
description: IoT companies cover multiple technologies, including ubiquitous computing and commodity sensors. Commercial products include "smart home" devices and appliances, such as lighting fixtures, thermostats, home security systems, and cameras.

name: Military and Defense
description: These companies manufacture military aircraft, defense systems, and firearms. They do well during growing military spending and in times of conflict.

name: REIT Industrial
description:
Real estate investment trusts are companies that own and operate real estate. REITs tend to pay meaningful dividends from the rental income they generate. REITs may provide some inflation protection as the value of real estate and rental rates increase with inflation.

Industrial REITs may benefit from expansion of production facilities.

name: REIT Office
description:
Real estate investment trusts are companies that own and operate real estate. REITs tend to pay meaningful dividends from the rental income they generate. REITs may provide some inflation protection as the value of real estate and rental rates increase with inflation.

REITs that invest in office spaces may benefit from economic expansion and more employees going to the office.

name: REIT Residential
description:
Real estate investment trusts are companies that own and operate real estate. REITs tend to pay meaningful dividends from the rental income they generate. REITs may provide some inflation protection as the value of real estate and rental rates increase with inflation.

Residential REITs may benefit from increasing rental rates and residential housing prices.

name: REIT Retail
description:
Real estate investment trusts are companies that own and operate real estate. REITs tend to pay meaningful dividends from the rental income they generate. REITs may provide some inflation protection as the value of real estate and rental rates increase with inflation.

Retail REITs may benefit from economic expansion and growing retail sales but can be harmed by increasing share of e-commerce.

name: Silver Mining
description: Silver mining companies acquire, develop, and operate precious metal fields, primarily mining for gold. The steady periods of growing silver prices benefit these companies.

name: Social Media
description: Global social media companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Ukrainian-Led Companies
description: Public stock companies led or founded by Ukrainians.

name: Utilities
description: Utility companies provide electric power, water and waste management, as well as other services related to infrastructure. Historically, these stocks are less volatile and have defensive qualities in times of market turmoil.

name: Video Game Industry
description: Global video game industry companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Virtual Reality and AR
description: Virtual reality and augmented reality companies listed on US stock exchanges.

name: Water Utilities
description: Companies that provide water and wastewater services for residential, commercial clients, and municipalities. Like most utilities, they tend to provide lower volatility and can be viewed as defensive assets. On the other hand, water utilities are often regulated. Therefore, their ability to catch up with inflation may be limited.

name: Railroads
description: The largest railroad operators in the US and Canada, as well as companies that produce and service railroad equipment. Railroad stocks may benefit from increased government spending on infrastructure. They provide cheaper and greener means of transportation for large shipments.

name: Inflation-Proof
description: An optimized selection of the largest stocks in sectors that have historically outperformed the market during periods of high inflation and increased probability of rising interest rates. Includes stocks in Energy, Real Estate, Banks, Insurance, Utilities, Food & Staples, and Retail.

name: Dividend TTF by Stocksfor2day
description: Equally weighted portfolio of high dividend stocks curated by stocksfor2day. The portfolio is aimed at providing a steady monthly dividend stream.

name: Green Investments by OrganizedFinance
description: A collection of companies that have made efforts to reduce their negative impact on the environment and use resources more sustainably.

name: Dividend Community Portfolio by DividendClub
description: Active dividend community portfolio for DividendClub using the dividend yield theory to identify buy and sell.

name: Shorting The Housing Market by TradingLab
description: Here is a list of inverse ETFs you could potentially use to short the housing market. This collection is curated by TradingLab.
